channel.title: Junk computer?
channel.description:
Well, Got a free computer and monitor. I'm keeping the monitor but I don't know what to do with the computer...
Its a Dell Dimension 4300s
Quick Specs: 256mb RAM 1.56ghz processor 20gb hard drive.
Is there anything I can do with it that will benefit me? Or should I try to sell it for a few bucks?

item.title: Junk computer?
item.dc:creator: @bootnecklad bootnecklad
item.description:
@bootnecklad wrote:

Fat Cookies:

Something that would be fun but rather expensive is to submerge it into mineral oil and overclock it.

Nice ideas! I wonder who you got them off…

Read full topic

item.title: Junk computer?
item.dc:creator: @ollie123 Ollie123
item.description:
@ollie123 wrote:

Lol nty. Why don’t you use it to try and find the highest possible prime number? Keep it on 24/7 and i’m sure you will get there eventually. Or if not, use it as a shitty webserver or something.

item.title: Junk computer?
item.dc:creator: @bootnecklad bootnecklad
item.description:
@bootnecklad wrote:

Instructables.com

Build a Nintendo NES PC

Ah, the Nintendo Entertainment System. Brings me back a lot of good memories: Super Mario Bros., Double Dragon, Megaman. It also brings back not-so-great memories....

Do that but I doubt you would be able to fit a NES, You could build your own case, heck you could even leave it in its own one and just play!

Read full topic

item.description:

[quote=“xEnt, post:9, topic:309790”][quote author=Speljohan link=topic=406233.msg3002496#msg3002496 date=1256116663]

if you get a hammer, i can see some benefit coming from this.
[/quote]Uhh its not that bad. I’d use it as a web-server or something similar for local use (if you are a webdesigner of course).

A computer doesn’t get bad in my eyes until it hits 128mb ram and < 1ghz cpu

thats not the case for me, anything below 512 ram, and 2.4ghz single core cpu is shit.[/quote]U surely live in an overly modern world

[quote=“eczema3, post:6, topic:309790”]Internet radio server isn’t a smart idea. They use ridiculously high levels of bandwidth, so your ISP will shut you down fast.[/quote]Only if u live in a terrible country

item.title: Junk computer?
item.dc:creator: @inertia inertia
item.description:
@inertia wrote:

Use it to make some sort of funky home server. You could replace the hard disk to use it as a file/media server. I’m always in need of an extra computer, I’d definitely find a use for it.

Ideas:

  • Robot (as a slave/sex toy etc)
  • Web/sql/ftp server
  • Print server
  • Internet radio server
  • Automatic food maker integrated with your fridge/freezer and microwave
  • Interactive doorbell system with webcam/usb/keyboard etc
  • A room guard

Read full topic
